posts.content:
I would like to beg, borrow, steal or buy some OG Devon cot brackets as fitted to A posts and B posts to either fit or make copies?

I have tried for ages to find some, someone must have some for sale, unwanted, not fitted or fitted that I could come and drool over.
I sadly want to know tube or pipe dims, wall thickness for the brackets and the poles so that I can search for material to make myself and others a set or sets.
Want them to look 100% OG..so need someone who has an OG set willing to help...lots of copies but want OG

These were for sale on eBay but were not a matching set. Are they copies?


These are images supplied to me by different posters who either saw a bus or who had a bus with these fitted. No one so far has replied who actually has a set fitted or a set like these in OG galvanised condition. I think this is an OG Devon set.

NS Front



OS Front




OS rear



NS rear

Well it is getting near to the time to make some. I would love some pictures and dimensions and wall thicknesses of tubes (cot pole lengths and wall thicknesses = OD - ID)
I expect someone may have the brackets but no poles which would be a good start.
The material on the brackets looks like heavy duty seam welded pipe. The ID and OD of this is the start point
Merry Christmas!
These would be very cool to remake

looking at doing something similar myself for the little ones
the brackets should be the easy bit just count the headlining dots to get near enough
its the cut away in the bracket thats confusing me , what stops the pole falling back out ??
my son could definetely knock that back out sleeping !!
perhaps the pole was sprung so when you push it into the slot and release it , it would go further into the tube and locate ????
thought i'd put a spanner in the works
ps great topic ,let me know if i can help with welding brackets/making cover etc
cheers Elliot

AFAIK the brackets have one side with a square cut end and the other end has a cut away section. The pole length is the exact size so that one end inserts fully into the square cut end and then the other end just drops just into the cut off section and slides towards the cut away end so in theory it is inserted and stays in both ends?
It did not originally have any springs but I suppose you could drill a hole through and put a retaining pin in?

Oh and as for trying the count the dots...I tried that and the material stretches and they are not evenly spaced on different sides so it would be an approximation.
On my 65 the X spacing is different to the Y spacing! LOL

yeah i see now ,but would definetely want something to hold the cut away end in place
yeah a pins a good idea something simple just to be on the safe side
do you recon these are %100 genuine devon then ? never seen a set !!

They are in the price list and my PO's son said his dad chose not to buy the cab cot but instead bought a transverse cot which I have.
and duracour cab seat covers...I saw both seat base covers and backs but PO's son chose to throw away the base covers because they were very worn and his wife was embarrassed by them.
So seen and bought but chucked away!



Have you considered fitting one of the transverse cots?
I can post pictures and these are simple to fit too!

quess we need to find out whos bus the pictures come from then
any ideas ??

yeah pics of transverse would be cool
does this go in the rear above the bed some how ???

My transverse hammock



is supported at the front on an awning rail on the cab side of the division and the other edge is supported on a pole between the front cargo door and the metal below the windows on the long side.



It is also attached to the front of the wardrobe by two turnbuckles.



I have posted pictures and details in threads before.......

i like that transverse one
the idea of not drilling the posts for the cab hammock apeal to me
got to find some vintage looking turnbuckles now
cheers and happy new year

Woolies sell the turn buckles and the eyelets (and the maybe the tool that punches the holes or did I imagine that? ...or use a piece of stainless steel pipe shaped to oval ground with a sharp edge on it?) Tool needed for vinyl but for for woven material the holes for the prongs are less important..

Punch is expensive maybe a buy and hire project?

http://www.woolies-trim.co.uk/c-60-turnbuckles.aspx

I collected some male fittings from a Dormobile cot cover with patina from a car boot sale..

My duracour for the 65 is bright ...but if you wanted to match existing maybe Ross Portobello or G plan fabric for the turqouise.
I will be getting covers and cots for the 64 made from Ross in Green...

just seen the price of the tool
will be making that one !!!lol
Anyone got any Devon cot brackets?

Still looking for a set of front cot brackets..
Beg borrow or steal to copy..
